Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Kris Letang leaves Penguins' game with apparent knee injury AP Published 9:02 p.m. ET Jan. 14, 2017 | Updated 12 minutes ago Jan 12, 2017; Ottawa, Ontario, CAN; Pittsburgh Penguins defenseman Kris Letang left Saturday's game with an apparent knee injury. (Photo: Marc DesRosiers, USA TODAY Sports) 
DETROIT — Pittsburgh Penguins defenseman Kris Letang twice left a game against the Detroit Red Wings on Saturday night after appearing to injure his left knee. 
Letang got tangled up with Detroit's Thomas Vanek early in the first period and twisted awkwardly on his way down to the ice. He got up slowly and tried to keep weight off his left skate as he went toward the dressing room. Letang returned briefly later in the period but left again and didn't return. — GIF Grand Maester (@myregularface) January 15, 2017 
Letang scored 27 seconds into the game, his fourth goal and 23rd point in 30 games this season. 
Letang missed seven games with a lower-body injury and five games with an upper-body injury earlier this season. Facebook A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Patrik Laine, forward, Jets: Out indefinitely with a concussion. Timothy T. Ludwig, USA TODAY Sports Canadiens winger Brendan Gallagher will miss at least eight weeks after undergoing surgery on a broken left hand. Jean-Yves Ahern, USA TODAY Sports P.K. Subban, defenseman, Predators: Out at least 2-3 weeks with an upper-body injury. Christopher Hanewinckel, USA TODAY Sports Matt Murray, goalie, Penguins: "Week to week" with a lower-body injury. Kim Klement, USA TODAY Sports Buffalo Sabres center Ryan O'Reilly underwent an appendectomy during the holiday break. He is out indefinitely. Kevin Hoffman, USA TODAY Sports Penguins defenseman Kris Letang was put on injured reserve Dec. 17 with a lower-body injury. He will miss a "couple of weeks." Kim Klement, Kim Klement-USA TODAY Sports Max Domi, forward, Coyotes: Out indefinitely following hand surgery. Matt Kartozian, USA TODAY Sports David Desharnais (51) and Alex Galchenyuk (27), forwards, Canadiens: Expected to miss 6-8 weeks with knee injuries. Kim Klement, USA TODAY Sports Corey Crawford, goalie, Blackhawks: Could miss up to three weeks following an appendectomy. Bruce Fedyck, USA TODAY Sports Brendan Smith, defenseman, Red Wings: Out "approximately four weeks with a sprained right medial collateral ligament," per the Detroit Free Press. Tom Szczerbowski, USA TODAY Sports Darren Helm, forward, Red Wings: Out at least six weeks with a dislocated shoulder. Tim Fuller, USA TODAY Sports Steven Stamkos, forward, Lightning: Out indefinitely after suffering a "lateral meniscus tear in his right knee." Vincent Carchietta, USA TODAY Sports Tyler Ennis, forward, Sabres: Out indefinitely following surgery on his groin. Kevin Hoffman, USA TODAY Sports Ales Hemsky, forward, Stars: Out 5-6 months following surgery for a hip injury. Jerome Miron, USA TODAY Sports Jonathan Quick, goalie, Kings: Placed on injured reserve with a lower-body injury. No timetable given for return. Kirby Lee, USA TODAY Sports Jonathan Huberdeau, forward, Panthers: Laceration to left leg, out until at least early January.
